meta.subject: Science
meta.philosophy: Quality, life long education for all which is accessible, inclusive and relevant to individual, national and global needs and value systems
meta.competence_learning: Key Competences to be developed are outlined on page 10 of this syllabus, covering Analytical Thinking, Communication, Creativity and Innovation, Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Environmental Sustainability, and Problem Solving.
goals: Foster curiosity to nurture a sense of wonder by encouraging young learners to ask questions, explore their surroundings, and make connections between the scientific concepts they encounter.

Foster scientific inquiry that promotes a hands-on approach to science by engaging young learners in simple, age-appropriate experiments to observe cause and effect, explore the properties of materials, and develop a keen interest in the world of science.

Encourage collaborative learning by recognising the importance of social interactions in the learning process. The activities should be designed to promote teamwork, communication, and the sharing of ideas, creating a supportive community of learners.
Encourage sustainable environmental management practices to evade the impact of climate change.
